definition: abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs

sentences.english: Hui Teman is considered as the inaugurator of Euramerican and free verse.
sentences.chinese: 惠特曼被認爲是歐美自由詩體的開創者。

sentences.english: Seven-word chanting poetry was a popular poetic form used by ancient Chinese poets.
sentences.chinese: 七言歌行是古代詩人常用的一種詩體。

sentences.english: Taking metaphor as the performance, " Hsing " is a special kind of poems.
sentences.chinese: “興”是以隱喻爲表現特徵的特殊詩體。

sentences.english: It is a style of poem applied by the poets in Sung Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 是宋代文人相互唱和的一種詩體。

sentences.english: Write an acrostic love note or poem.
sentences.chinese: 用離合詩體形式寫幾句充滿愛意的話或一首小詩。

sentences.english: Yet you also stress the importance of forms and prosody in polishing and revising poetry.
sentences.chinese: 可你又強調形式與詩體論對潤飾修改詩的重要性。

definition: a genre of poetry, developed in the Tang Dynasty, characterized by its strict form
to copy (a text) from person to person/(of a text) to be transmitted by copying
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
variant character/loan word/variant written form (for the same word)/different edition
lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)

History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls
